item.title: Two New Apostles
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: On Saturday (2 Oct 2004) two new Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints were called: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf and Elder David A. Bednar. As interesting aside, the church also published a list of Apostles born outside the United States.
item.content:encoded: On Saturday (2 Oct 2004) two new Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints were called: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf and Elder David A. Bednar. As interesting aside, the church also published a list of Apostles born outside the United States.

item.title: More Sacramento Temple Ground Breaking Coverage
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: The Sacramento Bee had another article covering the Sacramento Temple ground breaking. A lot of focus was given to President Hinckley’s sense of humor. I guess most people won’t expect a 94 year old man to have a pleasant sense of humor. The picture is from the Bee’s article. If you look closely at the […]
item.content:encoded:
The Sacramento Bee had another article covering the Sacramento Temple ground breaking. A lot of focus was given to President Hinckley’s sense of humor. I guess most people won’t expect a 94 year old man to have a pleasant sense of humor.

The picture is from the Bee’s article. If you look closely at the background, just right of center, you will see a young man with a white shirt and suit. He is a friend of mine, Brian Pebbles. Fun to see a picture of him and President Hinckley in the paper.

item.title: Sacramento Temple Ground Breaking
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Just as I mentioned last week, this afternoon was the ground breaking ceremony for the Sacramento Temple. Yesterday there was an article in the Sacramento Bee about the LDS church in Sacramento. We watched the ground breaking via the broadcast to the church buildings in the area. Our meeting house was packed, there must have […]
item.content:encoded: Just as I mentioned last week, this afternoon was the ground breaking ceremony for the Sacramento Temple. Yesterday there was an article in the Sacramento Bee about the LDS church in Sacramento. We watched the ground breaking via the broadcast to the church buildings in the area. Our meeting house was packed, there must have been close to 3000 people there I would guess. It is hoped that the temple will be completed in 18 to 20 months, so around March 2006 or there about.

item.title: Sacramento Temple Ground Breaking
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: If you are LDS and live in the greater Sacramento, California area next Sunday is going to be an exciting day. At 4:00 pm on 22 August 2004 ground will be broken for construction of the Sacramento Temple. The dedication is going to be broadcast to all 21 Stake Centers in the Sacramento Temple District. […]
item.content:encoded: If you are LDS and live in the greater Sacramento, California area next Sunday is going to be an exciting day. At 4:00 pm on 22 August 2004 ground will be broken for construction of the Sacramento Temple. The dedication is going to be broadcast to all 21 Stake Centers in the Sacramento Temple District. With any luck construction will be done by the end of 2005, perhaps more likely early in 2006.

item.title: David B. Haight Dies
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Elder David B. Haight, a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints died on over the weekend (Saturday 31 July 2004) at the age of 97. Despite his age this came as kind of shock to me given the recent death of Neal A. Maxwell.
item.content:encoded: Elder David B. Haight, a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints died on over the weekend (Saturday 31 July 2004) at the age of 97. Despite his age this came as kind of shock to me given the recent death of Neal A. Maxwell.

item.title: Neal A. Maxwell Dies
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell, a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, died yesterday (Wednesday 21 July 2004) at 11:45 pm at the age of 78. I’m sorry to see him go, he was a great speaker and leader.
item.content:encoded: Elder Neal A. Maxwell, a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, died yesterday (Wednesday 21 July 2004) at 11:45 pm at the age of 78. I’m sorry to see him go, he was a great speaker and leader.
